metadata.description: Comprehensive microscopy equipment knowledge base for MicroHub tag inference
data_sources: Manufacturer product pages (Zeiss, Leica, Nikon, Olympus/Evident, Andor, etc.)
Core facility instrument listings (Duke, Stanford, Caltech, Northwestern, etc.)

laser_details.notes: Exact laser configuration varies by order; WLL option possible

systems.notes: Flagship confocal 2025. Adds Lightfield 4D for instant volumetric imaging (up to 80 vol/sec). New high-bandwidth electronics. Airyscan jDCV for all Multiplex modes.
Mid-range confocal 2025 with Lightfield 4D and Microscopy Copilot AI assistant. High-bandwidth electronics.

detector_details.Airyscan 2: 32-element GaAsP array with Multiplex 4Y and 8Y modes
detector_details.notes: CO-detection mode for multiplex confocal + super-resolution

systems.notes: Flagship confocal with Airyscan 2. 4Y/8Y Multiplex modes for fast super-resolution. ~120nm lateral resolution with Airyscan.
Compact confocal, small footprint. Airyscan 2 standard. Ideal entry point.

detector_details.BiG.2: BiG (Big GaAsP) 2-channel non-descanned detector for multiphoton

systems.notes: Very widely installed system. First commercial Airyscan. Often found with multiphoton laser. ~140nm lateral, ~400nm axial with Airyscan.
Budget-friendly confocal with solid-state laser module. Compact design.
First confocal with 32-channel GaAsP spectral detector (QUASAR). Still in many facilities.
Introduced spectral detection to mainstream confocal. Large install base.
Entry-level solid-state laser confocal. Four fixed laser lines.
Legacy workhorse. META version added spectral detector. Still referenced in many older papers.
Line-scanning confocal for high-speed live imaging.

laser_details.notes: High-power lasers for SMLM; power varies by configuration

systems.speed: Up to 255 fps with Lattice SIM
systems.notes: Multi-technique super-resolution platform. SIM² reconstruction doubles conventional SIM resolution. Lattice SIM uses lattice spot pattern instead of grid lines. R&D 100 Award winner 2019.
New Lattice SIM family member (2023). Structured illumination super-resolution.
Entry-level Lattice SIM family member (2023).
First generation Zeiss super-resolution. PALM + SIM in one system.

laser_details.notes: Three laser lines standard. Spatial Light Modulator (SLM) for lattice pattern generation.

detector_details.cameras: Two Hamamatsu Fusion sCMOS cameras for simultaneous dual-color

systems.sample_format: Standard sample carriers: 35mm glass-bottom dishes, LabTek chambers, IBIDI slides
systems.notes: Inverted lattice light sheet. Uses standard sample carriers (coverglass #1.5 bottom). Fully incubated. Automated alignment. Near-isotropic resolution in confocal range.
Classical SPIM geometry for large cleared samples. Dual illumination. Up to 6 laser lines.
First commercial Zeiss light sheet. SPIM geometry. Still in many facilities.
Motorized inverted research microscope. Base stand for LSM, Elyra, Celldiscoverer systems. Definite Focus.2 for drift compensation.
Motorized upright research microscope. Used as stand for upright confocal.
Automated box microscope for walk-away imaging. Self-correcting optics. Modular.
Fixed-stage upright microscope for electrophysiology. Base for upright confocal/multiphoton.
Legacy inverted stand. Base for LSM 510/710. Very common in older publications.
First generation Zeiss slide scanner.
High-speed slide scanner. Up to 100 slides unattended. Multi-mode imaging.
FIB-SEM for 3D imaging and sample preparation. Samplefab variant (2024).
Field-emission SEM family. Gemini 2 column technology.
3D X-ray microscope. ART AI reconstruction technologies (2024).

laser_details.WLL: White Light Laser (WLL): tunable 440-790 nm, pulsed, total >6W visible, up to 8 simultaneous lines at 8nm intervals
laser_details.AOBS: Acousto-Optical Beam Splitter — no dichroic mirrors needed

detector_details.Power HyD S: Silicon-based hybrid, blue-sensitive, analog/counting modes, up to 56% PDE
detector_details.Power HyD X: Single-molecule sensitive, digital mode, for FLIM/FALCON
detector_details.Power HyD R: Near-IR optimized hybrid GaAsP, detection to 850nm
detector_details.notes: Filterless spectral detection via AOBS. No dichroic filters needed.

systems.notes: Flagship confocal platform. Extended WLL (440-790nm vs SP8's 470-670nm). Power HyD family detectors. TauSense lifetime-based contrast. AOBS for filterless spectral detection.
Core STELLARIS platform. Same WLL and Power HyD as Stellaris 8 but with fewer detector options.
STELLARIS 8 with integrated FLIM (FAst Lifetime CONtrast). Video-rate lifetime imaging. Pulsed WLL enables fluorescence lifetime measurements.

laser_details.optional_OPO: Optical Parametric Oscillator for extended wavelengths

detector_details.4Tune: 2-channel freely tunable-filter NDD with hybrid detectors for 2P
detector_details.descanned: 4 descanned confocal detectors: 3 HyD S + 1 HyD X (typ.)

objectives_compatible: HC FLUOTAR L 16x/0.6 IMM CORR VISIR (WD 2.5mm, for clearing RI 1.33-1.52)
HC PL APO 20x/0.75 IMM CORR CS2
HC PL APO 40x/1.10 W CORR CS2
HC PL APO 63x/1.20 W CORR CS2
systems.notes: Integrated multiphoton + confocal system. 4Tune spectral non-descanned detectors. DM6 CFS upright stand provides >1mm working distance for in vivo imaging.

resolution.notes: TauSTED combines time-gating with STED for improved contrast

systems.notes: Triple STED depletion lasers (589/660/775nm) cover broad fluorophore range. TauSTED uses fluorescence lifetime to enhance resolution. Down to ~20nm lateral.

laser_details.WLL: White Light Laser: 470-670 nm (narrower range than Stellaris)

detector_details.HyD: Up to 5 hybrid GaAsP detectors, time-gating capable
detector_details.tandem_scanner: Resonant (8/12 kHz) + Galvo scanner, up to 428 fps

systems.notes: Widely installed. First Leica with WLL and HyD. STED 3X variant had 3 depletion lines. Many still in active use.
Major workhorse system. SP5 II (2010) added AOBS improvements. SP5 X added WLL. SP5 STED was first commercial CW-STED.
Legacy system. Prism-based spectral detection. Still cited in older publications.
Triple depletion laser STED. Replaced by TauSTED on STELLARIS platform.
Motorized inverted stand. Base for STELLARIS, SP8, THUNDER, STED systems. Premium version (CS) for confocal.
Upright research microscope. FS/CFS variants for electrophysiology (fixed stage). Base for upright confocal/multiphoton.
Widefield with Instant Computational Clearing (ICC) for haze-free images. Multiple variants: Live Cell, 3D Cell Culture, Tissue, Model Organism.
Automated imaging platform combining widefield and confocal. AI-assisted. Multi-user walk-away system.
Industry-standard pathology slide scanners. Multiple models for research and clinical use.

laser_details.notes: Exact laser config varies. Up to 8 laser lines.

detector_details.DUX-VB: Variable bandwidth spectral detector, freely tunable emission bands, up to 66 emission channels for hyperspectral
detector_details.DUX-ST: Standard detector with up to 12/18 discrete bandpasses
detector_details.NSPARC: 25-element APD array detector for image scanning microscopy (ISM). Single photon sensitivity. Improves SNR and resolution beyond diffraction limit. Added 2023.

resolution.confocal_resonant: Up to 2048x2048 pixels, up to 800 fps (small FOV)

systems.notes: 10th generation Nikon confocal. 25mm FOV (industry-leading). DUX-VB variable bandwidth detector. NSPARC option for super-resolution confocal via ISM. AI-assisted acquisition.
Galvano-only variant of AX R (no resonant scanner). Same large FOV and detector options.

laser_details.visible: Standard visible laser unit for confocal mode
laser_details.multiphoton: Compatible with tunable Ti:Sapphire lasers (Coherent, Spectra-Physics)
laser_details.NSPARC: Also compatible with NSPARC for confocal super-resolution mode

systems.notes: Multiphoton variant with 2K resonant scanner and confocal capability. Up to 40cm under objective. NSPARC compatible.
25mm FOV variant of A1R. Resonant + galvano dual scanner. Widely installed.
Galvano-only confocal. si variant added spectral detector. Large install base.
Entry-level confocal. Compact scan head. Budget-friendly.
Structured illumination with fast acquisition. S variant adds speed improvements.
Single-molecule localization microscopy. Highest resolution of light microscopy systems (~20nm).
Flagship inverted research microscope. 25mm FOV. Base for AX/AXR confocal, N-SIM, N-STORM, spinning disk. E=motorized, A=semi-motorized, U=manual.
Previous-gen inverted stand. Very widely installed. Base for A1/A1R and older systems.
Motorized upright research microscope. For histology, pathology, materials science.
Fixed-stage upright for electrophysiology and in vivo imaging. Base for AX R MP multiphoton.

laser_details.notes: Up to 10 simultaneous laser lines. Industry-leading spectral range 400-900nm detection.

detector_details.SilVIR: Patented silicon-based detector technology. High sensitivity, quantitative, low noise.

systems.notes: Evident's flagship confocal. SilVIR detectors. 400-900nm spectral range (broadest). Up to 10 laser lines. Modular design.

detector_details.RS_variant: FV3000RS adds resonant scanner for high-speed imaging

systems.notes: Widely installed confocal. RS variant has resonant scanner. TruSpectral detector.
SIM scanner for simultaneous stimulation and imaging.
Widely used legacy confocal. Very common in publications 2004-2015.
Super-resolution spinning disk on new IX85 platform. Yokogawa CSU-W1 with SoRa. TruSight SR algorithm enhances to 120nm. 2024 launch.
Large-FOV spinning disk (26.5mm FN). CrestOptics X-Light technology. 2024 launch.
Previous-gen SpinSR on IX83 platform. SoRa super-resolution spinning disk.
New automated inverted platform (2024). Base for SpinSR, SpinXL, IXplore systems.
Workhorse inverted microscope. Base for FV3000/FV4000, SpinSR, IXplore systems.
Semi-motorized inverted microscope.
Motorized upright. For histology, pathology, and upright confocal base.
Clinical/research upright microscope. Manual with coded components.
Research slide scanner. Up to 210 slides. Brightfield and fluorescence.
Legacy slide scanner. Still referenced in many papers.

acquisition: Varies by integrator: NIS-Elements, cellSens, SlideBook, MetaMorph, µManager, Fusion

laser_details.notes: Laser configuration depends on integrator system

detector_details.SoRa: Super-resolution by optical reassignment. ~120nm resolution with deconvolution. Uses microlens disk with magnification changer.

systems.notes: Dual spinning disk unit (OEM). Integrated by many microscope manufacturers. SoRa variant adds super-resolution. Widefield mode available.
Previous-gen spinning disk. Very widely installed. Microlens-enhanced Nipkow disk.
Super-resolution via optical photon reassignment (SoRa). Uses dedicated microlens disk and magnification changer.
Compact benchtop confocal imaging cytometer. CSU unit inside.
High-throughput screening platform. Dual spinning disk. Automated plate handling.

laser_details.notes: Up to 10 laser lines via High Power Laser Engine (HLE)

detector_details.dual_camera: Dual camera port for simultaneous two-color
detector_details.spinning_disk: Andor dual spinning disk with Borealis illumination

systems.notes: Top-end Dragonfly. Up to 10 lasers. Borealis illumination. Multi-modal: confocal + TIRF + widefield + super-resolution. Compatible with multiple microscope brands.
Mid-range Dragonfly. 4-6 laser lines standard.
Entry-level Dragonfly.
Previous generation. Dual motorized dichroic sets (BGR and CY).
Compact benchtop spinning disk based on Dragonfly technology. Push-button imaging. Fusion software + Imaris ClearView deconvolution. .ims file format.
Modular imaging platform. SlideBook software for all 3i systems. Often paired with CSU spinning disk.
Licensed from Janelia/HHMI. Lattice light sheet with 3i integration.
Multiphoton imaging platform with SlideBook.

detector_details.Gatan_K3: Direct electron detector, 5760x4092 pixels, counting mode, super-resolution
detector_details.Selectris: Post-column energy filter for Krios G4

systems.notes: Gold-standard cryo-EM for structural biology. Automated data collection. Near-atomic resolution. G4 adds Selectris energy filter.
200kV cryo-EM. Screening and mid-resolution data collection. Compact footprint.
200kV cryo-EM workhorse. Very widely installed for cryo-EM.
Legacy TEM series. Spirit (120kV), F20 (200kV), F30 (300kV). Very common in publications.
Cryo-FIB/SEM for preparing thin lamellae for cryo-ET. Essential for in situ structural biology.
DualBeam FIB-SEM for materials and life sciences. 3D volume imaging.
High-end DualBeam FIB-SEM. Multiple variants (UX, CX, Hydra for multi-ion).
Extreme high-resolution FE-SEM.
Versatile FE-SEM. S variant for surface, C variant for compositional analysis.

detector_details.notes: In-column Omega energy filter. Cold FEG for superior coherence.

systems.notes: JEOL's high-end cryo-EM. Cold FEG source. In-column Omega energy filter. Competitor to Titan Krios.
Multi-purpose 200kV analytical TEM. Cold FEG option. Cryo-EM capable.
Widely installed 200kV TEM. LaB6 and FEG variants. Workhorse for materials and life science.
120kV TEM for biological samples. Flash variant (2018) adds automated specimen tracking.
120kV biological TEM. Easy-to-use interface.
Standard camera for Titan Krios. Direct electron detection. Counting mode for optimal DQE.

detector_details.notes: 16 megapixel CMOS. Good for in-situ and 4D STEM.

systems.notes: CMOS TEM camera for general-purpose and in-situ imaging.
Premium HCS platform. Confocal spinning disk. Water immersion objectives for high-resolution screening. Harmony + Columbus analysis.
Mid-range HCS. Same software ecosystem as Opera Phenix.
Versatile HCS platform. Confocal + widefield. Up to 9 wavelengths.
Entry-level automated cell imager. Compact benchtop.
HCS platform. LED illumination. Confocal option.
Optimized for cleared tissue / whole-organ imaging. Large sample chamber. Now part of Miltenyi Biotec.
Multi-view SPIM for developmental biology. Now part of Bruker.
Optimized for whole-brain / cleared tissue imaging. Automated tile-based acquisition.
Open-architecture dual-view light sheet. Mounts on inverted microscope. Isotropic resolution via dual views.
Single-view light sheet on inverted stand.
Open-source/open-hardware light sheet microscope. Wiki-based build instructions.
Open-source mesoscale light sheet for cleared tissue. Near-isotropic resolution. Multiple labs building worldwide.
3D-printed open-source microscope. Low-cost. Raspberry Pi-based.

laser_details.multiphoton: Compatible with: Coherent Chameleon/Discovery, Spectra-Physics MaiTai/InSight
laser_details.notes: Requires external Ti:Sapphire or OPO laser

systems.notes: Leading multiphoton for neuroscience. Multiple scan heads available. Resonant and galvo scanners.
Biplane 3D localization microscopy. High-throughput SMLM.
Modular multiphoton for neuroscience. Open architecture. Multiple scan head configurations.
Multiphoton with adaptive optics for deep in-vivo imaging.
Previous-gen multiphoton from Scientifica.
Movable Objective Microscope. Popular for electrophysiology + imaging. Open platform.
3D random-access multiphoton via acousto-optic deflectors. Fast volumetric calcium imaging.
Multiphoton for intravital and deep tissue. Now part of Miltenyi Biotec.

features: Compact module attaches to existing microscope
microscope_stands: Compatible with most major brand stands
systems.notes: Compact STED module. Attaches to existing microscope. Quick super-resolution upgrade.
Research-grade STED system. DyMIN and RESCue for reduced photobleaching. MINSTED for molecular resolution.
All-in-one fluorescence microscope. Very popular in core facilities for routine work. Structured illumination for optical sectioning.
Digital microscope for materials/industrial use. Full-focus 3D imaging.
Industry-leading slide scanners for pathology. Multiple models for different throughput needs.
Popular European slide scanner brand. Multiple throughput options.
